column4: hi all, I am having some installation problems with 11.04 32bit downloaded ISO
I have burnt to CD-R but when I try to boot from CD I get a message up on screen
What does the message say?
cannot mount /dev/loop0
sorry was attempting to copy paste...
cannot mount /dev/loop0
(initramfs) mount: mounting /dev/loop0 on //filesystem.squashfs failed: input/output error.
Can not mount /dev/loop0 (cdrom/casperfilesystem.squashfs) on //filesystem.squashfs
nope...I never do
based on this thread, I'm wondering if your iso download failed: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1556602
but I sure checked it afterwards and it was ok
so I've checked the ISOs md5 and it was good
I used ImgBurn latest version to burn the ISO
well, regardless of the cause, it seems that many install problems like this are fixed by using the alternate install cd
I have something else going on that I thought was a bit odd though...
when I boot from the cd I get the Ubuntu logo up for a while before the message...
when I tried it on another machine I got a diff logo...in fact it said Ubuntu 11.04
I burnt a CD have no DVD media
You should try the alternate install iso
the machine I am trying to install on had 9.04 but it failed to reboot
yeah i read a few threads that suggested that
didn't make much sense to me why that could be the case - any suggestions ?
yes, use the alternate install cd
